rounds.response:
[Player 0] River is Q♠ giving me Queens-full of Threes (QQQ33).  
Everything but pocket 9’s (99) for quads is crushed.  
I’m out of position but the board is not scary for my hand and Villain has called flop and turn, showing something he likes.  
A polarizing over-bet jam most likely gets looked up by any 9x, Qx, or stubborn overpair type hand, and it’s the line that extracts max versus those parts of his range.  

I have 870 chips behind left and pot is 240.  
Jamming all 870 is the biggest credible bet available, so:

[Bet 870]

rounds.response:
[Player 0] I’m the small blind and have already posted 20 of my 1960 chips.  
Player 1 has no additional chips left—he’s all-in for the big blind (20).  
Pot is therefore 40 and it costs me 0 additional chips to play my hand (option is Check or Fold, since the current bet is exactly what I’ve already put in).  
My 7♠ 4♥ is very weak, but I’m getting 40-to-0 odds (infinite pot odds) with no possible downside—the worst that happens is we run it out for the side pot, which is 0 in this case. Folding would technically save a minuscule amount of equity in the 40-chip pot we’ll split, but in a two-player game where Player 1 already cannot win any extra chips, there’s no reason to fold.  

Simplest action:  

[Check]
